body_html:
@AlexLuya you can actually use FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py develop to install both Pytorch and Caffe2 with Caffe2 python bits, or you can patch #8509 and use FULL)CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install

But it will likely still fail in the same way if it can't find the IDEEP files. How did you install MKL on this machine? It looks like it should look for IDEEP in third_party https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/cmake/Modules/FindMKL.cmake#L296 , so cc @yinghai who knows more about MKL. Are all your submodules updated git submodule update --init --recursive ?

body:
@AlexLuya you can actually use ```FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py develop``` to install both Pytorch and Caffe2 with Caffe2 python bits, or you can patch #8509 and use ```FULL)CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install```

But it will likely still fail in the same way if it can't find the IDEEP files. How did you install MKL on this machine? It looks like it should look for IDEEP in third_party https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/cmake/Modules/FindMKL.cmake#L296 , so cc @yinghai who knows more about MKL. Are all your submodules updated ```git submodule update --init --recursive``` ?
